document_metadata.name: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Emerging evidence suggests that AÎ² clearance is impaired in both early-onset and late-onset forms of AD.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: When characterized by autosomal dominant inheritance, EOAD is related to mutations in the presenilin 1 (PSEN1), presenilin 2 (PSEN2) or amyloid precursor protein (APP) genes.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Various factors have been reported to positively and negatively modulate the risk of LOAD. Specifically, the greatest overall risk factor for LOAD is ageing;

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: The strongest identified genetic risk factor for LOAD is the apolipoprotein E (APOE) Îµ4 allele (APOE*Îµ4),

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: although genome-wide association studies have linked LOAD to several other genetic variants, such as TREM2 (triggering receptor expressed on myeloid cells 2),27 clusterin (CLU),28 and phosphatidylinositol-binding clathrin assembly protein (PICALM).28,29

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Known envi- ronmental risk factors for LOAD include cardiovascular disease, and factors conferring a risk of cardiovascu- lar disease, such as diabetes mellitus and hypertension. Head trauma, physical and mental inactivity, and sleep impairment are additional risk factors for LOAD

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: The gross pathological changes consist of brain atrophy, particularly in the hippocampal formation, temporal lobes and parietotemporal cortices, accompanied by cortical thinning, enlarged ventricles and white matter abnormalities, as evident on MRI.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Recent advances now enable several AD-related brain changes to be detected in vivo: 18F-FDG-PET detects decreases in glucose metabolism,45,46 and MRI detects brain atrophy, as well as diffusion and perfu- sion abnormalities, which are most prominent in the vul- nerable hippocampal formation and cortical regions.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Recent advances now enable several AD-related brain changes to be detected in vivo: 18F-FDG-PET detects decreases in glucose metabolism,45,46 and MRI detects brain atrophy, as well as diffusion and perfu- sion abnormalities, which are most prominent in the vul- nerable hippocampal formation and cortical regions.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Given the size of AD-related proteins, mono- meric AÎ²1-40, AÎ²1-42 and tau, should be able to pass freely through astrocytic endfeet clefts at the glial barrier.72

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Given the size of AD-related proteins, mono- meric AÎ²1-40, AÎ²1-42 and tau, should be able to pass freely through astrocytic endfeet clefts at the glial barrier.72

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: First, expression of neprilysin is decreased in AD,126 especially in regions with high AÎ² loads such as the hippocampus and temporal gyrus.127

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Although overall matrix metallo- proteinase 2 expression is increased in AD,58 its activity is reduced in astrocytes that surround AÎ² plaques.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: In AD, these factors are impaired in a number of ways. First, expression of the blood efflux transporters LRP1123 and ABCB1147 is decreased, whereas expression of the blood influx transporter RAGE is upregulated.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: In AD, these factors are impaired in a number of ways. First, expression of the blood efflux transporters LRP1123 and ABCB1147 is decreased, whereas expression of the blood influx transporter RAGE is upregulated.

links.evidence: In AD, these factors are impaired in a number of ways. First, expression of the blood efflux transporters LRP1123 and ABCB1147 is decreased, whereas expression of the blood influx transporter RAGE is upregulated.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: In AD, the choroid plexus undergoes many structural changes, such as calcification, fibrosis and AÎ² deposition, all of which can obstruct CSF production.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: In AD, the choroid plexus undergoes many structural changes, such as calcification, fibrosis and AÎ² deposition, all of which can obstruct CSF production.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: ecifically, AÎ² accumulation into extracellular plaques is marked by decreased CSF levels of AÎ²1â42, and tau accumulation into NFTs is marked by increased CSF levels of total tau and hyperphosphory- lated tau.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Soluble AÎ² can be removed from the brain by various clearance systems, including enzymatic degradation and cellular uptake, transport across the bloodâbrain barrier (BBB) and bloodâcerebrospinal fluid barrier (BCSFB), interstitial fluid (ISF) bulk flow, and cerebro- spinal fluid (CSF) absorption into the circulatory and lymphatic systems.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: In the early 2000s, mouse studies demonstrated that the majority (75%) of extracellular AÎ² (eAÎ²) is cleared by the BBB, with only a minority (10%) being cleared by ISF bulk flow.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Third, ApoE4 is also associated with lower antioxidant activity than other ApoE isoforms,154,155 and it mediates BBB breakdown through a proinflammatory pathway involving cyclophilin A in pericytes.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: In the early 2000s, mouse studies demonstrated that the majority (75%) of extracellular AÎ² (eAÎ²) is cleared by the BBB, with only a minority (10%) being cleared by ISF bulk flow.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: However, two-photon imaging studies from the past few years have suggested that ISF bulk flowâfacilitated by astroglial aquaporin-4 (AQP4) channels and named the glymphatic (glial + lymphatic) systemâcontributes to a larger portion of eAÎ² clearance than previously thought.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: First, in ageing, and particularly in AD, CSF production by the choroid plexus is reduced, as shown by decreased water secretion into the ventricles via AQP1 water channels.

citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Third, ApoE4 is also associated with lower antioxidant activity than other ApoE isoforms,154,155 and it mediates BBB breakdown through a proinflammatory pathway involving cyclophilin A in pericytes.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: The pres- ence of ApoE4 is associated with reduced perivascular drainage of AÎ²,161 which in turn is linked to deposition of immune complexes.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Extracellular degradation of ISF proteins mainly consists of degradation by proteases expressed and secreted by cells such as astrocytes

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Specifically, ISF AÎ² can be taken up by microglia and astrocytes, whereas perivascular AÎ² can be degraded by vascular smooth muscle cells, perivascular macrophages, and astrocytes

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Intracellular degradation of proteins occurs via the ubiquitinâ proteasome pathway, the autophagyâlysosome pathway, and the endosomeâlysosome pathway.56

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Intracellular AÎ² (iAÎ²) can be degraded by proteasomes via the ubiquitinâproteasome pathway in neurons,116 lyso- somal cathepsin enzymes,117 proteases (such as insulin- degrading enzyme, a thiol metalloendopeptidase that degrades monomeric AÎ²) and insulin.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Tau is mainly cleared through intracellular degrada- tion by lysosomes via the autophagyâlysosome pathway, and by proteasomes via the ubiquitinâproteasome pathway.202

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Intracellular degradation of proteins occurs via the ubiquitinâ proteasome pathway, the autophagyâlysosome pathway, and the endosomeâlysosome pathway.56

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: The most common soluble monomeric isoforms of AÎ² are AÎ²1-40 (<80%), AÎ²1-38 (<20%) and AÎ²1-42 (10%).105 AÎ²1-40 is prone to be deposited in the vasculature, as seen in CAA.15,106

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: APP is cleaved by Î±-secretase, which precludes forma- tion of AÎ², and the resulting carboxy-terminal fragment is then cleaved by Î³-secretase.103 The resulting products do not aggregate.104

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: In addition, insulin-degrading enzyme has been proposed to have a role in AÎ² clearance through the BBB, which might explain why BBB clearance is sensitive to insulin.144

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: AÎ² is cleared along perivascular drainage pathways.83 In both AD44,160 and CAA44 (commonly associated with AD84), perivascular drainage of AÎ² is impaired.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: If APP is first cleaved by Î²-secretase 1 (also known as BACE1) instead of Î±-secretase, the subsequent Î³-secretase cleavage will result in soluble monomeric AÎ².

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: The most common soluble monomeric isoforms of AÎ² are AÎ²1-40 (<80%), AÎ²1-38 (<20%) and AÎ²1-42 (10%).105 AÎ²1-40 is prone to be deposited in the vasculature, as seen in CAA.15,106

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Intracellular AÎ² (iAÎ²) can be degraded by proteasomes via the ubiquitinâproteasome pathway in neurons,116 lyso- somal cathepsin enzymes,117 proteases (such as insulin- degrading enzyme, a thiol metalloendopeptidase that degrades monomeric AÎ²) and insulin.

citation.name: Nature reviews. Neurology
citation.title: Clearance systems in the brain-implications for Alzheimer disease.

links.evidence: Extracellular AÎ² can also be degraded by proteases, such as neprily- sin (a membrane-anchored zinc metalloendopeptidase that degrades the AÎ² monomers AÎ²1-40 and AÎ²1-42, and AÎ² oligomers),119 matrix metalloproteinases 2, 3 and 9,120 glutamate carboxypeptidase II,121 endothelin-converting enzyme,122 tissue plasminogen activator,123 plasmin,120 angiotensin-converting enzyme,120 and insulin-degrading enzyme.
